title.title: The Minor Poems of John Lydgate
Edited from all Available MSS., with an Attempt to Establish the Lydgate Canon

zone.line: BEhaldThe lower bow of the b is two lines high, while the upper limb is above the initial line. man lift vp thy ene and see
Quhat mortall pains I sufferit for thy trespace
With pietuouß woce I cry and say to the
Behald my woundis behald my pailethe EETS edition has "blody" hereface
Behald the rebukkis þat dois me so manance

Behald my enemes þat dois me so dissagisThe EETS edition has "despice." Based on the letter form of "grace" in the line following line and "p" in "appaelde" in verse 108 (folio 172v), "paradice" in verse 117 (folio 174v) and "pilgramage" in verse 118 (folio 174v) it seems more likely that the letter form is "g" here.
And how þat I ȝow to reformit to grace
Wes lik ane lamb affeort in Sacrafice
BEhald þe IowisThe EETS edition has "peynemes" here. of quhom I wes tak
Behald þe cordis with quhilk I was bund
Behald the harmes quhilk gart my hart quaik
Behald þe garding in quilk I was fund
Behalde hou Iudas tuke xxx dThe EETS edition has "pens," which is what "d" abbreviates to here. rounde
Behalde his tresoun behald his couatice
Behalde how I with mony a mortall wound
Wes Lik ane lambe offerit in sacrifice
BEhaldeWhile the capital letter here is two lines high the lower bow, rather than the upper, is in line with the initial line. and se to Cayphas how I was presintit
Behalde how pylot left me no respyte
Behalde hou bischopis war to my deid assentit
And hou þat herode had me at dispyte
ASimilarly to the beginning of this section on f.170 verso the initial letter is two lines, but carries over the top of the line rather than below.Lik ane fule how I was cled in quhyte
Drawn as ane felloun in maist dulf wyß
Wes lik ane Lambe offerit in sacrificeLine seven of this verse is missing here.
Behald and se þe haitfull wraichitneß
Agane me put to my confucioun
My ene blindit and hid with dirknes
Beft and eke buft be fals Illucioun
Saluft in scorne be þair fals kneling doun
Behald all þis and sit mortall gyß
How I onlit for mannes redempcioun

Wes like ane Lambe offerit in sacrificeThere is a line underneath the last four glyphs of this line, but that line does not appear to be a suspension. This may be meant to indicate to the reader that the following versee is meant to be elsewhere, as the following verse is 105. There is no indication between verses 104 and 105 on this page noting the shift.
Behalde þe ministeres quhilk hadme in kepyng
Behalde þe pyller and þe rapis strang
Quhaur I was bunde my sydis fast bleding
Most felly bet with þair scurges Lang
Behalde þe battell þat I did wnderfang

The wrangThe EETS edition has "bront" here. abyding ofWhile the initial glyph is unclear at first "offerit" in the first verse on the verso side of this page suggests this initial glyph is meant as "o." þe mortall empriß
Throu þair accusing and þair sclanders wrang
Was like ane lambe offerit in sacrifice
Behald þe witneß be quhome I was dispisitThe EETS edition has "deceyved" here.
Behald þe Iowes þat gaif me Iugement

Behald þe croceThe scribe's "c" and "e" are bloth split by a stroke, which makes this iappear to be "crocc" (or to our modern eyes, "trott") at first glance. However, the terminal glyph has a light stroke at the top that, when compared with "be" and "quhome" in the first line, make is clear the terminal letter is "e." þat was for me devysit
Behald my body withbetting all to rent
Behalde þe pepill quhilk of fals intent

Was offerit into sacryficeLines six and seven of the verse in other witnesses have been omitted here. Additionally, the construction of the final line earlier in the section, "was like a lambe offered in sacrifce," is different here.
Behald þe weman þat followit me on far
That for meThe EETS edition has "sore" here. wepit quhen I was þus assalde
Behald þe Iowes quilkes my Innomes wair
Hang my body wp till ane croce fast naylde
Behald my turmentis most scharplie apparelde
Betwyx two thevis put be þair Iustice
Behalde how mekelit my dedis eik awalde
That was for man offerit in sacrifice

Behalde þe speir was scharplie grond and quhetThe EETS edition has "whett" here. It's obvious the scribe intended to include the word here based on the rest of the line, the rhyme scheme, and the inclusion of the tironian et before it but the actual form of the word here is unclear.
My hert woundit apon þe ryght syde
Behalde þe reid speir gall and asell set
Behald þe scurgis quhilk I did abyde
And my fyve woundes quhilk was mad so wyde
That no man list of reuth till aduertyß
And þis I was of mekenes againes pryde
Ffor mannes offence offerit in sacryfice
Se my disciples hou þai haue me forsaik
And fro me fled almost euery one
Se hou þai slept and list not with me waik
Ffor mortall dreid þai left me all alone
Except my moder and my cousing Ihone
My deid conpleit in most dulfull wyß
Se fra my corps<note place="bottom anchored="true" n="informational">The EETS edition has "cross" here. þai list neuer gone
Ffor mannis offence quhenI baid assyßThe EETS edition has "did sacryfice" here.
Se hou I was Iugit to þe deith
Se barrabas gois to his liberte
Se with a speir hou longious me slaith
Behalde tua culloresThe EETS edition has "lycours" here. distelling don fra me
Se blude and water be mercifull plente
RanThe EETS edition has "Rayle" here. be my sydes quhilkis war ane with to suffice
To man quhen I apon þe rude tre
Was like ane lambe offerit in sacrifice
Behald þe knyghtis quhilk throu þair thrawert chanceThe final two letters of this line were lost when the manuscript was trimmed.
Behald my mothir swonyng for grevanceThe second line of verse 112, referring to how the soldiers diced for Jesus' robes, has been left out here due to scribal error.
Aponn þe croce quhen scho sawe me dey
Behald þe sepultur in quhilk my banis laythe final word of this line is set off from the rest of the words, most likely due to interference from the long descender in "dey" above.
Kerpit with strangThe first two letters here are unclear, but likely are "st" as a ligiture based on the most common letter forms and what is present in the other witnesses. wachis till I raiß
Off hell ȝettis se how I brak þe key

And gaif my blud in SacraficeUnlike earlier in this witness the initial glyph of "sacrifice" here appearls to be the capitalized form based on the touched letters throughout. It will be treated as such when it appears.
Agane thair prid behald my meiknes
Agains thair inwy behald my cherite
Agains thair th lichory behald my chaist clennes
Agane þair cowatice behald my powerte
Betiux twa thevis nalit till a tre
Raillit with Reid bluid þai list me so disgiß
Behald o man all this I did for the
Meik like ane lambe efferit in Sacrafice
Behald my lufe and gif me þin agane
Behald I deit thy ransoun for to pay
Se how my hart Is oppenint braid and plane
Thy gaistlie enemies only till affray
Ane harddar battall na man myght assay
Off all trivmphis þe gretest hie empriß
Quhanfor O man no langar þe dismay
I gaiff my blud for the in Sacrafice
Twrne hame agane þi synnis do forsake
Behald and se gif outht be levit behind
How I to marcy art reddy the to tak
Giff me thy hert and be no more vnkind

line.add: þi lufe and myn togader do þam bind
line.note: The scribe skipped this line, and has corrected the mistake by placing it to the right of the following line.

zone.line: And Let þam neuer depart in no wiß
Quhen þow Is lowsit againe þi saule to fynde
My blud for þe I offerit in sacrifice
Emprent thir thingis in þi Inwart thought
And graif deiply in þi remembrance
Think on me weill and forȝet me nought
All þis I offerit to do thy deligenceThe EETS edition has "And with my seyntes to yeve the suffisaunce" here .
In hevin a hom I do for þe devißThere's a slight variation between this line and the EETS edition. Where this edition has "In hevin a hom" the EETS edition has "In the hevenly court."
A place eternall a place of all plesance
Ffor quhilk my blud I gaif in sacrifice
And more my mercy to put to preife
Till euery synnar þat none sall It amßamyß
Remember how I gaif mercy to ane theif
The quhilk so lang had trespassit and done myß
Went he notht frely with me to paradice
Haue It in mynd how it is my gyß
That repenttis to bring þam to my bliß
Ffor quhome my blude gaif in Sacrifice
TAry no langer fro þin heritage
Haist in þe way and be ritht gude off scheir
Go Ick day on warld to þi pilgramage
Think hou schort a quhile þow sall abyde heir
Thy place Is beld about þat sternis cleir
None erdly place wrotht in sit a wise
Cum on my freind my broþer moist enteir
Ffor þe I offerit my blud in sacrifice
